Description: Razor with stylized wooden handle and a bronze five-sided blade, held in place by two rivets.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (Japan 1999-2000): No 42

Similar razors were found at Amarna: Frankfort and Pendlebury, The City of Akhenaten II (1933): 35, pl.34 [1]. Egypt's Golden Age (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1982): 191 [220-1] Razors were a common component of elite 18th dynasty burials (for Thebes, see Smith, MDAIK 48 (1992), 207-8.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1984 May-Jun, Italy, Comune di Padova, Un' arte per la bellezza 1984 Oct-Dec, Switzerland, Villa Malpensata, Un' arte per la bellezza 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son of Luxor's Sands 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed 2002, St Albans, Life and Death
